meanings.definition: To make or become smaller or less significant in comparison.
meanings.sent1: The tiny plant was bedwarfed by the tall tree next to it.
meanings.sent2: The mountain range bedwarfed the small hill in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The giant cake bedwarfed the tiny cupcakes on the table.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter bedwarfed the noise of the bustling city streets.
meanings.sent5: The bright sun bedwarfed the dim light of the moon.

meanings.definition: To cause to appear smaller or less impressive.
meanings.sent1: The large sign was bedwarfed by the massive billboard next to it.
meanings.sent2: The grand castle bedwarfed the humble cottage nearby.
meanings.sent3: The elaborate costume bedwarfed the simple outfits of the other party guests.
meanings.sent4: His talent bedwarfed the skills of his competitors on the stage.
meanings.sent5: The majestic ship bedwarfed the small boats in the harbor.
